intro: Endiandra muelleri subsp. muelleri, commonly known as the Mueller's endiandra, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy white flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Its subspecies is distinguished by its specific floral morphology and leaf structure. It is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
